intro: Lychnis grandiflora, commonly known as the showy campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically solitary or in small clusters, with five petals that are often notched at the tips. Lychnis grandiflora is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
